TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1053-1054
TEI.2.document_title: William Johnson to Stephen F. Austin, 03-01-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: William Johnson to Austin, March 1, 1825. Introducing William P. Perkins.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1053-1054

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*William Johnson to Austin, March 1, 1825. Introducing William P. Perkins.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Woodville*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="03-01-1825">March 1st 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir,*/p*
*p*This will be handed to you by *person_mentioned*Mr. William P. Perkins*/person_mentioned*; a respec- table and wealthy *person_mentioned*planter*/person_mentioned* of this country—*person_mentioned*Mr. Perkins*/person_mentioned* visits your *location_mentioned*Province*/location_mentioned* with the view of acquiring Land and ultimately establishing a *location_mentioned*sugar or Cotton farm*/location_mentioned* in your *location_mentioned*province*/location_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*Mr. P*/person_mentioned*. has respectable and extensive *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*connections here as well as in the State of *location_mentioned*Tennessee*/location_mentioned*—No doubt, should he be pleased with your *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned* and future prospects there, he will ultimately move there and be the means of many valuable *person_mentioned*citizens */person_mentioned*mooving there both from this *location_mentioned*State*/location_mentioned* and from *location_mentioned*Tennessee*/location_mentioned*— I have been personally and intimately acquainted with him for many years and have no hesitation in saying [he] would be a valuable acquisition to your *location_mentioned*settlement*/location_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*Mr. P*/person_mentioned*. is now waiting and you will therefore excuse this crude Note.— */p**p* *person_mentioned*Wm Johnson*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Hon. Stephen F. Austin */person_mentioned**location_mentioned*Province of Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
